title: Concern for  those who are C.E.V.
body: Following on from my visit on 15th of this month, I yesterday (18th) received a letter informing me that since I  had failed to attend or cancelled the appointment, another appointment could not be sent, and that I would now be referred to my G.P. I was extremely distressed to receive this, since I had experienced severe respiratory problems, was using Ventolin, and had explained that I had to leave and get fresh air. As the symptoms exacerbate, speaking becomes difficult and inadvisable. I didn't know that I was supposed to have informed the receptionist that I was C.E.V. and had assumed that arriving not more than 10 minutes before an appointment meant that this was a precaution meant to prevent people being around for a long time before being seen. If so, it failed in my instance, since I was in the reception area for an hour and forty minutes, wearing a mask which restricted my already compromised respiration. I continued wearing it , since I cough often, since as afore mentioned , I have C.O.P.D.

title: The best GP surgery there is
body: The doctors are superb and always have time for even tricky issues and requests; the nurses also perform to the highest standard; receptionists and other practice staff also efficient, warm, kind, and helpful. This practice always finds a way to sort a problem, no matter what. Electronic prescriptions also sent rapidly and without issue - unlike everyone else I know at other GP surgeries! I feel very lucky to be able to access King Edward Street; everyone there has made a real and lasting difference to my health and my faith in the medical profession.

title: Best hospital!
body: No words can express my admiration and gratitude towards the Royal Brompton Hospital and the ICU team for their amazing work.  During the first wave of the pandemic, the caring, expert staff worked tirelessly and valiantly to save my life.  I will be forever grateful to the doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and all members of staff who patiently took care of me.  Thank you to everyone.  May God bless you!

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional
body: Just to say I moved to this area a year ago and finally registered with this new practice. I’ve got a special needs son who needs lots of medication and everyone had been so helpful with this. I’ve never been with a medical practice that is so friendly and professional as this one ... communication is outstanding compared to my old practice that I liked but hadn’t realised how out of date and touch they were .. the whole website is so helpful too and easy to use .. the Drs I’ve dealt with so far have been brilliant also and reception team also fantastic... keep up the amazing work. My daughter also registered and I’ve been so impressed with the support she’s received also on various occasions. Brilliant all round.

title: Great practice
body: I had surgery after being admitted to ward 21. I would like to thank all the staff, nurses and doctors who helped me through a difficult time. They were brilliant and looked after me really well. Thankyou!

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you, 10 South...
body: ...and Charing Cross Hospital medical staff, for the outstanding care our daughter is currently receiving after a very traumatic event. Your expertise and kindness are beyond words, and in visitor-free Covid times, your communications and updates are especially precious to us. Special thanks to the angels who sit by our daughter's bedside - and to the Ward Administrator who rescued me from a meltdown when my daughter was still phoneless, and told her everything she needed to hear from me, before I could do it myself. Thank Gd for you all!

title: Awful communication
body:
Didn’t communicate with
Client took decisions with speaking to client and family and I would
Not recommend

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have attended this practice for many years and always been extremely impressed. This year I feel it has surpassed itself, which is extraordinary considering the challenges they must be under.
The Reception Team have been really understanding, professional and kind. The Medical Team have been superb.
A big thank you to you all.

title: Professional care
body:
Methley park hospital was chosen for me by mid yorkshire n h s.
I had no idea what to expect for my second knee total replacement.
I should not have been concerned as the care and professional service provided were excellent. Friendly reassurance from staff is important when you are vulnerable and afraid. I have no hesitation in recommending this hospital.

title: Professional Surgery
body: Very well run Surgery i have just moved into the Area and compared to my previous run Surgery they are very accessible for appointments

title: Very good care and attention.
body: I fell and hurt my wrist last night, very painful. Was not dealing with it brilliantly. The whole team were splendid from triage to xray. Everyone was so careful with my arm and caring. I was really tearful and they all had a terrific approach. I just wanted to say thank you to each and every staff member. You're doing a grand job!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor Practice
body: My mum came out of Winchester hospital last week. She reluctantly agreed to a care package. I witnessed the carer phoning prior to a visit to ask if she was required. My mum said no as I was there. The problem with this, is that if they always phone first before visiting she will always say no as she does not want the care package but she desperately needs it. I have reported this to her GP.

title: Great practice & caring staff
body: I received first class care from the doctors and staff at Taunton Vale surgery. They were well organised and time efficient. And most importantly I felt safe and cared for despite the pressure that the pandemic has put on NHS care providers. Thank you

title: Flu jab
body: Quick efficient service   Very well organised. Staff friendly and didn’t feel a thing. Good organisation with keeping distances etc

title: Great Practice
body:
I was made to feel very safe and comfortable even though I was very nervous
All staff were professional efficient and friendly without being too familiar, especially the young lady who carried out the procedure
Thank you

title: Questionable practice
body: Having nothing but praise for treatment to date, I now have to question the total lack of covid protective equipment during my recent visit. Neither the Doctor nor his assistants wore any form of mask.  Is this acceptable practice?

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thoroughly satisfied
body: Triaged within 10m of arriving, treated within about 30 minutes, excellent response. Quick, friendly manner, lovely nurses and excellent doctor. Could not rate higher.

title: Excellent service again
body: Had a concern about a condition. Called the surgery and was advised that the duty doctor would call me back. Duty doctor called back within 15 minutes. She reasured me and prescribed some medication. Collected the medication and all therefore sorted within less than two hours. Fabulous services. Thank you.

title: Superb service
body:
The physiotherapy team at Princess Royal are absolutely outstanding. Following total hip replacement surgery, they provided the very finest help, support and encouragement. Their mindfulness, care and awareness were exceptional and they made me believe in myself and what I could achieve. Their good humour and positivity were infectious and their visits were a real lift to my spirits. Since being discharged I have surprised myself at the progress I have continued to make and my heartfelt thanks for this is directly due to the physiotherapy team.
I cannot thank them enough, they are the very best.

title: Great team
body: We are so grateful to the entire maternity team at North Middlesex hospital, from the antenatal services, maternity day unit, triage, the labour ward, doctors and community midwives. Everything is so professional and runs so smoothly, and on top of that all staff are so kind and personable. Thank you so much for all the care and support during our pregnancy and the birth of our daughter!

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Great Surgery
body: Friendly, efficient and well run practice - telephone appointments make straightforward ailments quick and easy to diagnose and the surgery have great systems in place for dispensary collections and physical appointments.

title: covid
body: We were referred from our GP practise in Havant for vaccination, the whole experience in Waterlooville was exceptional, well done to all concerned

title: Awful reception .. great Covid test staff
body:
Attended for a Covid test.. no signage apart from in paperwork saying “ left door” approached main reception which was locked ( that’s fine , I get it) but as I was unsure where to go I buzzed .  To be greeted by the most obnoxious gent, clearly annoyed by my “ where do I go?” Question, he nodded his head to show me which way the door was , tutted and shook his head.. so very rude, my anxiety was already through the roof and he made it even worse.. I apologised for disturbing him . Found the correct door after wandering in the “ nodded” direction to be then greeted by a lovely lady, who reassured me and did my test .. fab nursing staff! Thankyou ladies! 
I hope Santa brings the gent a personality for Xmas.. failing that maybe he should work in a less customer involved role. 
Merry Christmas !

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you for your kindness
body:
My Mum who is 83years old came for her Coronavirus vaccination this morning, Sunday 20th December. 
She was a little confused and disoriented when she came out of the hospital. Thank you to the kind caring member of staff who directed Mum home. We are very grateful, she is home safely. 
Happy Christmas to you all and stay safe.

title: COVID vaccine process - brilliant!
body:
What a good experience! 
My mom’s 96 and just had her COVID vaccine.
It was so well organised throughout the whole process, with all of the staff and helpers being friendly, courteous and very respectful to my mom.
Well done The Oaks - great work!

title: Good flu jab service
body: No waiting. Straight in for flu jab. Efficient to have one practitioner giving jab and another at the computer doing the records.

title: Professional and helpful
body:
Seen by a Doctor and had everything explained to me for my over night sleep test.  Nothing was to much trouble and as always the staff were friendly and helpful.
Just waiting to be re called for sleep test.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Excellent .
body: Following a call to NHS 111, I was offered an appointment within 1 hour, and was treated with much care and kindness. Thank you.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Marvellous Care
body: Attended as a day case for Retinal Surgery on 18 Dec.Caring efficient staff who explained all procedures.All  staff from nurses to  Anaesthetist to Retina Surgeon were professional and caring.Recovery room staff were so pleasant even making me extra cups of tea as so thirsty when I woke up.All I would say though is the Appointment letter  for my op  did not and still hasn't arrived after surgery,This is a worry for any follow up Appointments as I do not want to miss any follow ups.I only. got a copy from Clatterbridge when I went there for Covid swab as needed it for proof of op for work.The post system needs to be looked at.Other than that a massive Thankyou to all concerned in challenging times.You are all heroes.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cataracts
body: I had a cataract removed over 1 week ago and was dreading it but found very little discomfort and rested for the remainder of the day and the next day I was absolutely fine, no pain or discomfort and what is even better  -  I COULD SEE  -  I am really pleased with the new lens and cant wait until the other eye is done.  i did use the shield and the drops as prescribed.   I have worn contact lenses for over 50 years  -    Thank you very much  M Chapman

title: Fantastic and courteous service from all
body: Excellent service from the call handler to the paramedics who kindly took care of my husband last night, Thank you to you all from the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Flu clinic was really well set up. Drop in clinic was great. No queue, fast and efficient service. Very well organised.

title: Great hospital
body: No words can express my admiration and gratitude towards the Royal Brompton Hospital and the ICU team for their amazing work.  During the first wave of the pandemic, the caring, expert staff worked tirelessly and valiantly to save my life.  I will be forever grateful to the doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and all the members of staff who patiently took care of me.  Thank you to everyone.  May God bless you.

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful Staff at A&E
body: Thanks to all the wonderful staff for looking after my husband last night, after suffering from an extremely bad nose bleed, so appreciated in these very busy and scary times.

title: Quick, efficient & friendly
body: Attended for my annual flu jab - very friendly team, in and out very quickly, and felt very COVID safe.

title: Excellent staff
body: So grateful for the kindness, consideration and very good treatment received by all staff in the Cataract Theatre on Friday 18th December 2020

title: Professional service
body: Very well organised system for my first ever flu jab . Especially considering these difficult times we are in

title: Useless
body: Referred to them in June for March lockdown agonising frozen shoulder. No face to face just a promise of a scan & an email with excercises. July chased & promised I was not forgotten.  I WAS!  November after many very painful months & withered arm I got offered a scan many miles away.  2 days later my Doc re-referred to local area different provider & told scan & excercises were not suitable & MRI needed. Useless!

title: Sad decline
body:
Made to calls on two separate days first time waited 22+ minutes before the call was answered, the second call was still unanswered after 34+ mins at which point I hung up. 

Had a telephone consult with GP only to discover the letter I had left at the surgery prior to the appointment hadn’t been read, in fact the GP read it while taking the call. The letter had asked for several items to be repeat prescribed. We’re having to send a second letter in asking for them to fulfil this request made by my consultant. 

Clearly not patient focussed. We’ve been with this practice for over 20 years and it is sad and disappointing to see that it no longer seems to be interested in its patients.

title: Caring and Kind Service
body: I had to have a blood sample taken in an outside Gazebo on a wet and cold December morning (2020). The practice nurse (wish I could say her name to single her out for praise - but I did send an email direct to the practice manager) was kind, efficient and very caring. I never felt a thing but it was her lovely (sorry can't think of a better word) approach to me when she was probably cold herself .  Moved to find this site and say 'Thank You'!

title: No need
body: I accompanied my wife to salford royal today for her covid vaccination. I took her up to the Mayo building and decided it would be better to go back to the scot lane car park and wait in my vehicle. Whilst walking back to the car park I found myself needing a loo. I have a fistula  and sphincter damage and cannot hold on for long. I decided to nip through dermatolagy to use the loo just outside there. I was wearing a mask and about to gell my hands when the chap on the door asked if I had an appointment. I explained my plight. To which he answered you cant come in. I told him how desperate I was and he still refused me. I told him I had travelled from Rochdale with my wife and needed the loo. To no avail. What happened next was embarrasing tto say the least.. thank you. I am disabled too.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Bad service
body: I went with a shoulder injury was told I needed a scan but never heard nothing else ended up in a and e then got referred back to the surgeon and booked for another scan again heard nothing can't blame the surgeon or the team at a and e but it seems the system is failing and I am left in extreme pain which is affecting my work and life. If the NHS in Cumbria are not doing scans due to covid at least have the decency to let people know and not let people think they are getting treated when they are not

readBy.name: x North Cumbria Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Mabintyk
title: Change of implant
body: I changed my Implant which was due and it was time to take out - Dr Rauf was sooo lovely and welcoming! We made me feel extremely comfortable even though I was a little nervous about it despite that she was very professional and lovely, open to having a chat. such a lovely doctor.

author: Another Screen Name
title: Autism in women
body:
For many years I suspected that I had Asperger's, but as a reasonably functional middle aged woman I imagined that to persuade a GP to refer me for assessment was going to be pretty much impossible. The vast majority of stories from women on the spectrum show that generally GPs seem pretty ignorant and ill-informed about autism and particularly how it manifests differently in women (ie not so obvious/hidden or masked).  
I plucked up the courage after years of putting it off and made a telephone appointment. One of the female GPs called me. I wish I remembered who it was as I would wish to thank her personally.) I had a whole speech planned, but I didn't need it. She made a referral without question and I am forever grateful to her.  
I was diagnosed with Asperger's 15 months ago by the equally fantastic autism service in Hackney who had provided training to the GPs in Hackney.

title: Great treatment
body: Cut my toe open today on a broken glass bottle. Was seen in A@E by a lovely nurse within 90 minutes, x-rayed by friendly radiologist 10 minutes later and bandaged up and sent on my way by said lovely nurse very soon after. Struck by the camaraderie and pleasant atmosphere among the staff in difficult times. Many thanks and a merry Christmas to all.

title: eye clinic - good experience
body:
Eye clinic - Sunday 20/12/2020

Lovely staff, swift treatment, well managed social distancing.  Much more convenient to have doctor analyse image results at a later date and only recall the patients that need to see them.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: A great place with supportive staff
body: The GP Surgery is a very welcoming place with a high level of care and attention given to me over the last 15 years I have been with this practice. Thanks to reception staff, doctors, and nurses.

title: So very impressed
body: Just wondering if Emerg services know how much they are valued by the majority of us. Had experience of paramedics today and am just sooo full of praise for them. Did job brilliantly professionally but also with compassion 100% for our nhs ambulance team

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor practice
body: Yet again i had to contact my GP practice at Peartree Pratice. My heart sinks every time and expectations always low. Simple request for some help made and response was complete refusal in a cruel uncaring and upsetting manor. This is unfortunately the norm for my experiences but sometimes you have to make contact. If it was upto me i would never contact them again. Made to feel like a worthless inconvenience as usual, not a patient in need. These comments apply to the all staff although there is one good male receptionist who is very helpfull.

title: Efficient and Caring Practice
body: Well led and a responsive practice. Administrative staffs very efficient and caring.  Information and alerts for visiting and booking on-line appointment are easy to follow.

title: Very poor indeed
body:
Some nurses are A1 which is good as I've only ever seen a nurse (do Dr's exist)
My complaint has been going on for 12months
I contacted a consultant who in the past has helped me no end  and he said he would see me again as in his opinion I needed to see a consultant
I arranged for my gp to call me. I have the information I had only to be told I had a problem in that they wouldn't refer me. 
I left the Monro and saw my new gp within 2 weeks  guess what, immediately I was referred to see a consultant of my choice as my gp agrees my condition is out of control

I know my body  and complaint better than most so if I give 12months to any practice to help me and don't feel any improvement I would expect a gp to help or at least even see me face to face 

Extremely disappointed and let down

title: Rude behavior of the GP
body:
I had an ENT appointment on 12th Dec 2020. The GP sounded extremely rude.The odd behaviours were: 1. he denied to listen to my problems (the GPs have always listened patiently and have asked for the history which he didn't) and said don't tell me everything from the beginning and just 'come to the punchline', 2. When I told him I was taken aback by his behaviour then he said that was his 'style' of working. 3. rather than checking the records he wanted dates and year for my previous tests from me (one cant remember the dates and years), to which I had to tell him very explicitly that he can check the records.
In short he didn't listen to all my issues, expected short cut talk and dates from me rather than looking into my records and I am extremely unsatisfied by my appointment with him for which I waited for a year. I didn't get answer clearly for all my problems from him.

title: Waiting time for blood test
body:
I was disappointed that no one informed me of a delay with my blood test appointment.  After 20 mins I had to ask if there was a problem as I arrived early and no one had gone in ahead of me.

Reception advised there was computer issue holding up my appointment.   

The nurse was apologetic and I understood.  However  I feel reception could have been more proactive in letting me know.  

Otherwise am impressed with flu clinic which I attended.. well organised and very safe.

title: All ticking along
body: Despite the madness going on around us. I have severe health problems and the Doctors went out of the way to phone me and make some arrangements for the hospital. Yes it took a while to answer the phones but If I didn't hang on I wouldn't have had the contact.We have to make allowances and I have complete confidence for the caring attitudes of all the staff

title: Wonderful
body: Had to attend for a gastroscopy. Nervous because I’d not had one before. Everyone at the centre was kind and pleasant to me and made it as easy for me as they possibly could. I won’t be so afraid of this procedure again and I can’t praise them highly enough. Thank you! :)

title: Good doctors
body: I made a telephone appointment recently. The doctor was meant to call me at 11.00am but eventually I received a call at 12.45pm. So, not as efficient as it might have been but the doctor was attentive and when I explained my symptoms she asked to see me in person that very day and when I turned up I waited for 10 minutes and I was then seen. She was courteous and thorough and reassuring too. This is a difficult time for everyone and I hope that doctors can be as accessible as possible because the corona virus is not the only health issue facing people.

title: Wonderful staff and care
body: I just want to thank all the team at the gyne assessment unit who looked after me whilst I miscarried. I was out of town and was in Birmingham and came to a&e with heavy bleeding and clotting. They were so wonderful compassionate and caring and made sure I was ok and gave me all the support I needed. It was a very scary time for me as I had no family support around me and all I can do is thank them from the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body:
I attended here for a spinal epidural on Saturday, I can honestly say I never felt a thing and all the staff were excellent
Thank you very much.

title: Wonderful, caring team
body: Every single member of the team are helpful, efficient and compassionate. With two young children (one born in the first lockdown) we’ve needed to contact the practice more often this year than usual but have been so well supported by them whether it be for routine procedures such as baby checks and vaccinations or more urgent consultations. Despite the enormous pressures that GP services and the NHS in general are under, we have been given appointments promptly when needed and on every occasion effective advice and treatments were provided. A very big thank you to the whole team.

title: Very compassionate treatment
body: I was contacted by a lovely compassionate doctor who listened and gave me great prompt advice. Really appreciated the care being provided in such difficult times.

title: Excellent care
body: I was admitted via a&e with a fractured ankle which needed surgery. I can’t thank the staff on ward 15 enough all of the nursing team, students and cleaning team were amazing. They made me feel a lot less nervous going for my  surgery. Thank you to everyone on ward 15!! Thank you also to orthopaedics and anaesthetic team too they too were outstanding!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Flu Jab.
body: Fantastic organisation to administer my jab. I was in and out of the surgery in less than 3 minutes. Wish all things in the NHS could be organised this well.

title: So far so good
body: Having just moved city and registering here, I can say that so far it has been the best GP practice. Registering was down quickly and the lady knew what she was talking about when I needed advise on how to. Collected forms, filled them and was registered within a week of giving them back. I have a health problem which needs continuous intervention and this has not been interrupted at all, if anything it's now better with the GP here. Needed flu and pnemonia vaccinations for the 1st time, again arranged within a week. Need to be transferred from a non Leicester hospital to here, again they arranged for a doc to call me to sort out. So far my experience has been brilliant. When I went for my vaccinations, the nurse took my bloods as they didn't have any on record. She also explained how the surgery operates. Their website is so informative and has everything you need, that's how I found out about registering.

title: Great practice
body: We recently had to use the surgery a few times for myself and my son. We have always been able to get a call back on the same day when needed (and a video call on one occasion when I couldn't come in).  The new doctors seem friendly.

title: Excellent service, the best I have ever come…
body: The staff were extremely helpful, I didn't have to wait long and the health practitioner was thorough, professional, friendly, helpful and did not rush me. Great job, thank you.

author: BlueJ
title: Trying to access GP services
body:
I tried to contact the Healthcare Surgery today - here is my story  
12:30 today started with bladder infection, something I have had many times, normally get a 3 day course of antibiotics. Rang GP thought if I got a prescription to the pharmacy 5 mins walk away it would straightforward, and save the surgery time since they are busy with the COVID vaccine.13:30 put through to out of hours and then advised to phone GP after 14:3014:30 phone GP advised a prescription would be sent through but check after 416:15 phone GP sorry hasn’t done it I will check and phone you back16:45 receptionist phoned to say GP won’t do prescription I have to phone 11116:53 phone 111 told I must phone my GP as it’s not out of hours17:15 get through to GP, advised a doctor will phone you17:45 Receptionist phones to say GP won’t speak to me or do a prescription and I have to phone 11117:53 phone 111 It’s too early I have to phone after 18:00During all this time I have been in a lot of pain, spent most of the afternoon on the loo and basically feel crap18:05 finally someone takes my details, I have to wait now until an out of hours GP phones 18:34 Out of hours GP just phoned and prescribed antibiotics. I now have to get a taxi to pharmacy to collect as my local one is now closed. What should have been a simple process has taken hours, caused me stress and upset and prolonged the pain. The amount of cost to the NHS with all these calls, 3 lots of screening with NHS 111 etc how is this helping. I rarely phone the practice because it’s so difficult to speak to anyone but today I knew what was wrong with me and a simple prescription was all that was required.I must add that the reception staff are always brilliant, I can’t praise them enough but they are limited in what they can do.

title: Urgent Care terrible attitude
body: I went to A&E at 4AM this morning (19/12/20), and was referred to the Urgent Care Department. There was only myself and one other person, but we were both kept waiting for some considerable time. The attitude of the nurse I eventually saw was appalling, she treated me like I was a nuisance. I had to have an x-ray, so saw her twice, both times the same dreadful attitude, and both times she was tapping in to her mobile phone before I'd even left the room. I would like to apologize to her for interrupting her social life! If I wasn't in so much pain I wouldn't have been going there in the middle of the night, would I? She could bearly be bothered to speak to me. Iam always polite and friendly to people, and expect the same in return. In future I'll go to Queen Mary's and hope for a better, kinder and hopefully more pleasant experience should I need to.

title: Lost prescription AGAIN!!!
body: After calling the surgery to find out why for the third time in 12 months my repeat prescription was not issued to the pharmacy by Riverside, I was assured this would be completed for today 20th December. Having been to the pharmacy this has not been done and yet again the pharmarcy refused to issue emergency medication due to Riverside incompetence. I am now without medication again therefore I will have to go to Weldricks pharmacy, wait whilst 111 is called to approve emergency medication. This pharmacy unlike the one based in Riverside surgery is really helpful and understands if you take medication on a daily basis you need it in order to stay well. Perhaps its time to its time to investigate these negative reviews in respect of Riverside NHS uk?? ?

title: Excellent service
body:
December's appointment in the Urology Department was one of many I have had since February 2020 - I have nothing but praise for all the staff who looked after me.
They have been kind, caring and informative - I am very
grateful to everyone, thankyou so much

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Frightened girl
title: A judgement without seeing me in person
body:
Have been a patient here for three years and used to be impressed until recently. This year some doctors have left and not been replaced so I have much more chance of getting a doctor I would rather not speak to now.  
In person appointments have been very rare, mainly telephone consultations (I do understand why). I have a breast lump, specified three doctors I felt able to discuss it with, didn't get any of them. Got a doctor who didn't take me seriously at all, telling me it was 'probably an abscess'. I feel they were influenced by the fact that I am young and have had abscesses on other parts of my body in the past. Never a breast one though. I don't see how they can make a judgement without seeing me in person or referring me to a hospital that can.  
Women constantly get told that breast lumps must be checked out, your GP can still see you even during COVID-19, well I tried that and got nowhere. Now I feel let down and frightened. all the other staff here are great but this one doctor has really upset me so I guess I'll have to change GP.

author: BrMac
title: Spent an age on hold
body:
I find the service they provided by Nene Valley Medical Practice falls far below that which we the public, have a right to, and deserve.  
If there is a problem you firstly have to spent an age on hold and then get a surly, uncooperative response at reception which usually fails to satisfy your needs, or worse cut off with no explanation.  
I have spent the last 4 working days trying to get a batch of repeat prescriptions organised without success, this is usually organised with a memo attached to my prescriptions.  
In this period I have made 3 phone calls to the practice, 4 visits to the pharmacy, 2 visits to the practice plus several hours of my time trying to sort this out.  
If I was an exception it would not be too bad, but this is the experience of all I know.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Pipse96
title: Pink rose suite
body:
After noticing a breast lump I was referred to the pink rose suite for tests. From start to finish my experience was fantastic. The staff are wonderful. Within an hour and a half I had seen the consultant, had ultrasound scans, mammograms and biopsies taken on the lump. The consultant also referred me for genetic counselling due to my family history of breast cancer.  
The staff unit seems to work very efficiently and the staff communicate with patients in a caring but honest manner.  
I couldn’t recommend this unit more. Thanks to all the staff there.  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']  
[Very happy with 'Explanations']

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ruby86
title: Brilliant work from Live Well at Home
body: Ruth from Live Well at Home gave fantastic advice and sorted out lots of practical help such as improving the bin collection, sorting out disability living allowance, getting continence service involved and supporting me to live at home.

author: Lennymore
title: Disability Discrimination
body:
Today I took my father to an Ophthalmology appointment in Lagan Valley Hospital. We are both face covering exempt (medical reasons) and to prevent any aggravation, we wore our Hidden Disabilities lanyard which clearly states we are exempt from face coverings. By law, we do not have to display, explain or prove our disabilities.  
Having attended just a few weeks previously to the same unit under the same conditions where we met no discrimination, I believed today would be the same.  
All went smoothly with pleasant staff until we got to the empty waiting room. The nurse who we had initially presented to came round to ask us to wear a visor. I lifted my exemption lanyard and explained this. They again asked us to wear a visor and again I had to explain that a visor is a face covering and we are medically exempt. They then said it was for the staff's protection, thereby implying that my father and I were walking contaminants who would contaminate everything around us. This was insulting, degrading and humiliating, especially given that there were 4 staff members all standing around huddled together with zero social distancing between them!  
Whilst the Ophthalmologist themselves was pleasant and efficient and the other staff very pleasant and approachable, staff need to be fully aware that face covering exemption does not just cover a mask but covers all types of face coverings and that they must respect hidden disabilities the same way that obvious disabilities are respected. After today's experience, my father and I feel scared about going back to Lagan Valley and we felt very threatened and bullied. I hope we never have to return there.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Staff
body: I had to collect some medication from this practice owing to my long term condition. The front door staff were particularly fantastic, helpful and on the ball! My script was sorted out in a matter of minutes. Big thank you to all there great help through this pandemic!

title: Outstanding efficiency in difficult times
body: Well done Branston surgery on the super efficient system you have in place keeping everyone safe in these times. I have had to visit the surgery a few times over this period and on every occasion, every single member of staff has made sure everyone is greeted on the door and kept at the appropriate distance. I have found no problem getting an appointment, all the clinicians have still managed to keep their usual cheery disposition and professionalism in trying times too. So a big thank you to the surgery and all concerned.

title: Excellent service
body: After hurting my back and being unable to walk I recieved a call back from a doctor within 30 minutes, good advice  ,a prescription and a sicknote for my employer . Much appreciated and merry christmas .

author: room22
title: wonderful treatment thank you everyone
body:
From emergency arrival to discharge; a wonderful, caring and professional service.  
Thank you to every staff member who worked so hard in making me feel better.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

title: Excellent care and treatment
body: After receiving swift help from SW Ambulance service my elderly mother was given immediate attention and head CT scan. The stroke consultant was present to give immediate diagnosis and treatment. Care was superb and communication with me was first class. Staff team work was excellent and efficient including an agency nurse. Staff were kind and caring including considering my own well - being. Thank you. It is so reassuring during these challenging times that the NHS team continue to provide an excellent service for all. It is particularly impressive that working conditions are challenging in A and E with the building improvements being carried out simultaneously.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: The best GP I have ever had
body: Such a wonderful team, I have never had such a fantastic GP! All the doctors really care, and go out of their way to make you feel reassured. They never rush you out the door and are generally a pleasure to deal with.

title: Efficient flu jab
body: Not much else to say. Only waited five minutes and the jab was pretty painless. They called us by text so we didn’t even have to remember to book it ourselves.

title: Good practice
body:
I have recommended the practice to a number of people.
Any medical problems raised have been attended to assessed - I have a lot of confidence in advice given.
Appreciate the steps taken to facilitate access using IT

title: Great practice
body: Dr was very friendly and made me feel right at ease for my flu shot.  Gave lots of information about vaccines and why it’s good to get them every year.

title: Outstanding care in the Ultrasound Dept.
body:
I can't imagine how private treatment could be better than this...

My appointment was for 2pm (internal and external pelvic ultrasound), and required a full bladder. The radiographer took me in EARLY, which was extremely kind of her, because it meant I was comfortable a lot sooner.

She was gentle and reassuring, explained everything clearly, and responded to all my questions and concerns. She offered me a chaperone but I felt completely safe, and I can honestly say that the whole experience was as pleasant as it could be under the circumstances!

Thank you Radiographer:)

author: eaternp35
title: Labour & birth
body:
I gave birth at the beginning of January to my first baby. At my 40 week appointment I was measuring big so I was told I would need to be induced.  
Whilst I wasn’t against induction, I feel like I didn’t have enough time to process the information as within 30 seconds of being told this I was already booked in. I felt like I had no choice in this and I wish I was given the opportunity to discuss this with the midwife and agree with her that this was needed rather than being told this would happen to me.  
However, the care that I received was phenomenal. The midwives were absolutely incredible and I cannot thank them enough for the care that they provided me with whilst I was in hospital. They were very understanding, caring and reassuring and treated me with the upmost dignity and respect. They helped me with breastfeeding and checked how I was coping which felt good to be asked.  
Once I was discharged from the hospital the community midwives were lovely. I was having trouble with breastfeeding and once I rang, they were straight out to my house which I really appreciated.  
Midwives don’t get enough credit for the work that they do and they really made my birthing experience pleasant, relaxed and actually enjoyable!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Carameltop87
title: Neonatal care
body:
My son was admitted to neonatal shortly after a c-section birth,he was having problems with his lungs.  
After a few hours of rest I got a visit from a nurse who had pictures of my little dude, this gave me reassurance that he was doing OK, even tho I knew he was poorly it still helped put a smile on my face.  
Once I got out of bed I went through to neonatal to see my wee dude, but before I seen him his nurse Deborah stopped me and updated me on his condition and told me what to expect.  
Deborah is an amazing nurse, not only did she look after my little bundle of joy she looked after me ensuring that I was comfortable in the chair whilst holding him. She gave me lots of support as I was struggling seeing my wee dude so poorly, if it wasn't for covid I'm sure she would have gave the best hugs. Deborah listened to all my worries and concerns and didn't judge me. So I would truly from the bottom of my heart like to say thank you to Deborah for everything.  
I would also like to thank Janice. She also looked after my wee dude when he was really poorly and helped to comfort me when I wasn't coping. So again thank you to Janice for everything and looking after my wee dude, he is thriving.  
I wanted to write this as I wanted to share my experience of the amazing staff at FVRH neonatal. And nothing personal I hope when I have baby number 2 I don't need to see you again.  
Thank you from the bottom of my heart and my husbands for looking after our wee prince and getting him well enough to come home.  
Yous are all truly amazing xxx

author: cheviotward22
title: Help and guidance
body:
I arrived at Rampton Hospital feeling angry scared and lonely I didn’t know what to accept cos throughout my life I have struggled with change only relationships and my appearance.  
At this time self-harming has been my only coping mechanism and have been a part of my life since I was 14. Self-harming had led to have some stoma bag which I have been in place 1.5 years before I came to Rampton.  
I felt scared that I would never be able to get this reserved which is something I’ve been hoping for from long time.  
At first I thought staff were my enemy over the past two years and two months they have helped me by;  
being there for me, helping me through rough times especially with my stoma, teaching me to trust people, having faith in me, never giving up on me and proving I trust people, role modelling making, me feel safe, Getting through my stoma reversal,  
the Now I’ve had my stoma reversal I just want to give a big thanks to all the Cheviot staff past and present for all the help and guidance I really appreciate it

author: Sobriety
title: Well supported through the pandemic
body:
I am a service user at CGL along with cambs recovery service Huntingdon. Throughout the pandemic they have adapted safely ensuring structured and non structured groups and 1:1 support is still available plus new groups, via zoom, telephone, face to face following guidelines, Cgl have put so much work into providing a wide range of the above, they work closely with service users to identify what support is helpful and what we may wish to see happening, something is available every day on the the timetable.  
I feel very well supported, listened to and part of a community, face to face weekly post detox group is of great benefit to me after coming home from detox in October this year , I am also so grateful with the ongoing support with a further rehab application , Non structured groups on zoom include, recovery cafe, lets talk recovery, obscurer things, cooking , media power hour, fortnightly quizzes , wellbeing and more new groups on the way , all of the above has aided my recovery so much , today we were able to have a Covid safe face to face Christmas gathering , very well organised with lots of fun decorating jumpers for Chistmas, I am so thankful for all of CGLS dedication no matter what.

author: Johnny101
title: The Golden Ticket
body:
I would like to encourage those out there that may struggle with alcohol dependence. Or feel they drink too much. I have been alcohol dependent for the last four years. But am now, thanks to acknowledging that it was a problem and getting the help I needed, 15 days dry. Most won’t have even noticed I had a problem but I was good at hiding it!  
How it started?  
One night four years ago I had a seizure whilst in bed. It gripped me like a vice. My body was shaking yet I was conscious of what was happening. I immediately got tinnitus. A very loud ringing in my ear which I still have to this day. I didn’t know how to cope and after six months of heavy depression and panic attacks I reached for the bottle.  
At this point I hadn’t drank for 10 years. At first the wine was to me medicinal and helped for a while but soon my drinking became the main problem and after years of abuse, 30units a night, my liver was starting to struggle. Then 2020 came around and the almost total lockdown and loss of jobs drove me deeper into dependence.  
As the year set in I started to make new decision’s for my future, building my career and focusing on what I enjoy. But in order to reach my full potential and be around to see the results I knew I had to face my fears.  
I reached out to change grow live in Nottingham and joined their weekly zoom meetings. I was told after blood samples and an assessment that if I could lower my intake to 15 units a day for an extended time I could be considered for a monitored home medical detox. (Normally it would only happen in rehab)  
This was a golden ticket for me and it’s the best thing I have ever done. It’s not been easy and I had to want it 100% which I did and still do. I still attend the zoom groups and will continue to do so for the foreseeable future. The team that helped me were and are incredible people. From Kerry the nurse calling me everyday, to Rachel my support worker who talked and walked me through the process, to Dean who selflessly administered the zoom meetings each week and to John who travels to my home to encourage me and check I’m on track. I thank you all!  
I still have thoughts and maybe always will, but thoughts don’t kill you but alcohol dependence will.  
Anyway all that to say whatever you may be struggling with please please please do not keep it to yourself. There are professional people out there that can and will help if you want it.  
I wish you all a happy, healthy Christmas and a prosperous new year.

author: Counsellor31
title: Disappointment with labour care
body:
Arrived at admissions at 5pm, 4cm dilated with first baby. We had been timing contractions so I had an idea how far along I was, but was sadly met with immediate dismissal by midwife (before she checked me). Seemed inconvenienced by our arrival & seemed to assume we were being over eager as first time parents. Appeared surprised when they checked and discovered I was 4cm.  
Was then admitted but only to A Ward (non labour ward) without explanation why this was. I had visited ABC unit during pregnancy & verbally requested this if possible on arrival, as well as having detailed written preference for birthing there in my notes (which sadly I believe to have been ignored). Was left for several hours at the end of the non labour ward, briefly greeted by different midwives on a handful of occasions & offered oral pain relief. Felt highly conscious of the labour noises I was making whilst all other women around me were Not in labour.  
By 9.30pm I was 9cm dilated and my husband had to run up the ward to encourage someone to come to us, at which point I was rushed to delivery suite to push and baby was born safely by 11pm. Very happy with consequent care in delivery suite by an experienced midwife and a student midwife who were both encouraging and caring. However, feel let down by lack of care prior to that point and confused as to why I was left to labour mostly alone (except thankfully for my husband) at the end of A ward. My guess is that the speed of my labour was faster than many first time mums, and assumptions were made that proper checks could be delayed with me until a shift handover took place.  
Now pregnant with second baby, due March ‘21 and discussed my prev. experience with a very helpful attentive midwife at my 28 week apt. who checked my prev. notes and relayed that there was no reason recorded why I couldn’t have laboured and delivered in ABC unit before. Advised me to speak about this preference again at every opportunity from now on in this pregnancy, as well as adding extra sheets of A4 to my current notes specifying this, so it is ‘unavoidable’ to notice this time. Also recommended encouraging my husband to strongly advocate for me again and often in this respect.  
I will do all of the above but am discouraged that I now feel obligated to pester staff in order to have preferences acknowledged and supported this time. (To clarify, I had no pregnancy or labour complications whatsoever so these preferences were reasonable and simple, making it even more bewildering for us why they were ignored.)  
Through my first pregnancy, I had felt calm and open-minded about all aspects of delivery previously, including agreeing to student midwife care at various points. I had my preferences but I additionally really put my trust in the staff to guide us supportively through our first baby’s birth, and I believe we were let down for no real reason I can identify. This time I now sadly feel less trusting and more apprehensive about what lies ahead.  
Thank you again to the midwives who gave my sweep and who safely delivered our baby boy. My experience with admittance and labour at the Royal does not diminish my gratitude for those members of staff who helped us through other important stages.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: decemberhc66
title: COVID assessment centre
body:
Last week my gran took unwell, within two hours she had an appointment, had been fully assessed and given medication for home. Not only was this an amazing service, but all staff involved were so helpful, kind and friendly.  
I just wanted to say a huge thank you, you all have such a difficult job to do and you attitudes were very much appreciated at such a worrying time.

title: Always good service
body: Prompt service and always helpful. I have had to contact the service on numerous occasions recently due to an on going health problem. They always help, they are always kind and understanding. Thank you

author: Noddens93
title: Covid contact
body:
I have been in and out of hospital for the past 2 months with gallstones. I have had 2 admissions to ward 6. The nhs staff In general from A & E & ward 6 have been amazing.  
During my second admission to hospital I was moved to the ward after having amazing care in A & E. I was in a room with 4 other woman and when I was seen by the surgical team I requested to get home as I had work commitments, a family wedding & 2 young children at home. The surgeons agreed to let me home .. after about 10 mins I was happy to be leaving until 2 nurses had to come In and explain we had been in contact with a patient who had now tested positive for COVID-19. I was extremely upset about this as I am now having to isolate , miss a family wedding & cancel all my work before Christmas. I am self-employed and this year has been so stressful without being able to earn money. I do not understand why this girl was moved to a ward into a room with 3 other people while waiting on Covid-19 test results! The worry of getting this virus is horrible, while I was in the ward having obs taken with the same blood pressure monitor & pulse checker on 4 people in the room without being sanitised inbetween patients is extremely worrying. The guidlines clearly state you must isolate until you receive your results & sanitising tools and equipment is a number 1 priority to stop the spread. The clear lack of communication between hospitals and generally a situation that could have been avoided.  
The stress and anxiety this has caused me being a new mum for the second time this year and suffering with so much pain and having to attended the hospital regularly in the past few weeks has made me feel so scared to come back if I need urgent medical help. All the staff are completely amazing and I admire the job they do although someone has gone wrong in this situation as potentially could have spread this virus due to a lack of communication.  
I wanted to make you aware about this experience as I feel this could have been avoided. I hope someone can get back to me on this. This is not a complaint about the medical care I just want to try and help make sure no one else is put in the same situation.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Good practice let down by individual receptionist
body:
Had an unfortunate phonecall with OSS this morning to ask for a telephone appointment with a particular doctor (as advised by reception yesterday) due to changes in my condition in ref to my breast clinic referral.
 Receptionist did not even look on the system and was very rude and short with me. Informing me that there was likely no appointments to after christmas. I informed her of yesterdays conversation and that I have found lumps. She informed me that she will update the medical receptionist and put the phone down.
I called back to confirm and now the doctor is calling me back. I query the recep. is that today? and she said bluntly yes. Thank you. Bye.
I felt very uneasy after this call, especially with my current symptoms. I would think anyone especially a woman, in this case, would have been a lot more polite and professional even if she was having a rough day.
Apart from this receptionist (which Ive had similar encounters before) the rest are lovely and professional and the medical staff go beyond to help out even when not asked.

title: Flu Vaccination
body:
Well, I must say I'm impressed. 
Went for my first ever flu jab Saturday morning. I'd been informed to be prepared for queueing outside and at first seeing the queue stretching around the corner I thought it would take forever. But - parked the car about 9:10 and joined the queue. Was at the reception desk at 9:16, called forth, sleeve rolled up, jabbed, out via back door and sat back in my car at 9:20!
Well done Mosborough nurses. Super efficient with the jabs so praise is due.
This is the way to handle mass vaccinations.
Looking forward to the call for the covid jab now.

NB. I find the recommendation question irrelevant because you cannot choose your surgery. If you live in the area then you've only got Mosborough surgery.

And when it comes to the phone line that's another story. Getting thru to the reception by phone is near on impossible. You're on hold forever and then you get cut off!
Much improvement required on the phone service.

title: Ideal Practice
body:
Staff were vigilant with coronavirus rules, setting an fine example to all concerned, ensuring patient safety at all times, doctors especially so.
The practice is clean, tidy and pleasant to visit, parking is adequate with clearly marked areas for disabled parking bays. The doctor I saw was polite, courteous and listened to my concerns with understanding and empathy, giving clear explanations and advice during my visit. I would not hesitate to recommend this practice to anyone.

title: Mixed feelings
body: Over the last few weeks I have had really mixed experiences with the surgery. On one occasion I phoned at 8am and was 5th in the queue for over 40 minutes, at which point I gave up. On another I phoned at the same time, was again 5th in the queue and was answered within 5 minutes. The staff at the surgery are always friendly and polite. Sometimes they go that extra mile to help you, other times they can be totally unhelpful.

title: Helpfulness of ALL  Staff iNCLUDING the Medical…
body:
I have been in rude health thank G-D for basically ALL my years 
I have been a patient of this practice in excess of 40 years 
I have had scant use of the Practice until this October when I suffered a myocardial infraction. It resulted in surgery; a bypass. 
Recuperating has been fraught with set-backs. 
The Practice, receptionists and medical staff, have just been awesome in their assistance and willingness to be of help in relation to all relevant matters I am experiencing currently.
I wish to stress the receptionists as they are the first responders and without their active co-operation nothing could even begin.
Thank you all @188

title: Drive through flu vaccination
body: Whole process from the practice making initial contact, booking the appointment, confirmation by text to delivery undertaken in a professional manner. Just hope the covid vaccination is rolled out in the same profession manner.

title: hopeless pratice
body: why why why does anything you require from your people have to be so hard 2 weeks ago asked to see a member of staff was kept waiting 45 mins while they carried needle boxes up and down corridor fully ignoring me waiting then today telephoned with a simple request to order my wife's medication but then meet with no you have to get chemist to order it we wont do it over the telephone so please tell just what is it your staff do all day now you have covid as an excuse to not deal with patients but ok it does not matter i will break covid rules and come to surgery and order wife's medication hope that makes you people happy putting me at risk because your looking for any excuse not to do any work. R.miller really fed up with the very poor service from your surgery yet again. p.s can i have the standard reply please ty.
